text: Jesse Woodson James (September 5, 1847 â€“ April 3, 1882) was an American outlaw. He was the most famous member of the James-Younger Gang in 1875. He was shot in the back of the head and killed by Robert Ford, a member of his gang for a $10,000 bounty that was placed on James by then-Missouri governor Thomas T. Crittenden. == Other websites == *Official website for the Family of Jesse James * Category:1847 births Category:1882 deaths Category:American Baptists Category:American folklore Category:American murder victims Category:American robbers Category:Murders by firearm in the United States Category:People from Missouri Category:Bushwhackers
title: Jesse James
